CustomKarlachArrest.synopsis: Karlach was sent to prison during Gortash Confrontation and while escaping she is seen by a guard.
CustomKarlachArrest.how_to_trigger: 1. Recruit Karlach as companion using the debug book.2. In the origin debug book: Karlach --> Act 3 --> Gortash Confrontation --> Teleport to Audience Hall.3. Start ceremony with Karlach nearby. Let her attack Gortash so she is sent to prison.4. After the scene in the origin debug book: Karlach --> Act 3 --> Gortash Confrontation --> Teleport to prison.5. Free her, recruit her back and let her be spotted by a guard.

SoulConsumption.synopsis: After a difficult fight and defeating Gortash, Karlach stands over the battle and accepts - for the first time - that permadeath is coming for her.
SoulConsumption.how_to_trigger: With Karlach in your party, fight Gortash and defeat him.Using the origins debug book:1. Load BGO_Main_A2. Recruit Karlach3. Karlach -> Gortash Confrontation -> Kill Bodyguards4. Karlach -> Gortash Confrontation -> Teleport to Gortash"5. Start fight and defeat Gortash

CustomKarlachArrest_0.speaker: Narrator
CustomKarlachArrest_0.text: *It seems someone has ordered that despite your escape from jail, you remain unharmed... at least for now.*

SoulConsumption_112.speaker: Wyll
SoulConsumption_112.text: I think she needs a moment to herself.

SoulConsumption_23.speaker: Minsc
SoulConsumption_23.text: You are wise, Boo. Let us... give her a moment.

SoulConsumption_44.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_44.text: So Gortash is nothing more than a pile of flesh, same as the rest of us.

SoulConsumption_7.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_7.text: Why doesn't it feel like I won? Why do I just feel so godsdamn tired?

SoulConsumption_55.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_55.text: Is that it, then? I've killed the bastard who ruined my life, and now I crawl into a corner and die?

SoulConsumption_14.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_14.text: I did whatever it took to get what I wanted. Just like he would've.

SoulConsumption_74.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_74.text: Where's my sunset to ride off into? My bard to play me off stage...?

SoulConsumption_12.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_12.text: Nothing's coming, is it? I killed the bastard who ruined my life, and my prize is that I get to crawl into a corner and die.

SoulConsumption_148.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_148.text: Calm down. You must've known this was the only possible ending.

SoulConsumption_27.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_27.text: Knowing and believing aren't the same thing. Not by a long shot.

SoulConsumption_24.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_24.text: This is it. This is what we worked so hard for.

SoulConsumption_21.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_21.text: It makes no sense. None of it means anything.

SoulConsumption_56.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_56.text: He... he wasn't even sorry for hurting me so fucking bad.

SoulConsumption_120.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_120.text: I'm still dying. I'm dying. He killed me! I'm going to die!
SoulConsumption_120.context: NodeContext: Finally breaking down emotionally, beating chest with one hand, evoking the infernal engine that's killing her.

SoulConsumption_89.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_89.text: I'm not dead yet. Not yet. Not yet.

SoulConsumption_121.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_121.text: For how much longer? Long enough to finish what you started? Long enough to get back your heart? Fat fucking chance.

SoulConsumption_97.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_97.text: I don't want to die. Please, no.

SoulConsumption_87.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_87.text: It isn't fair. I was so young when... so naive. They stole my. Heart.

SoulConsumption_73.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_73.text: My heart. My heart. It was mine! From my mother. From mum.

SoulConsumption_26.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_26.text: There's still hope. I can fix the engine. Stabilise it.

SoulConsumption_5.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_5.text: Please! Fucking give it up. There's no miracle coming. There's no hope. You can die here in your home, or you can go back to being tormented in fucking Hell. Those are your two options.

SoulConsumption_43.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_43.text: I'm going to be as dead as Gortash any day now. Any moment. And what then?

SoulConsumption_76.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_76.text: Off to the City of Judgement to waste into oblivion? Into the dirt to get eaten by maggots? Is that it for me?! Is that fucking all?!

SoulConsumption_128.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_128.text: And the others - they'll just keep going. Singing, dancing, loving each other, all of it, all of it, without me.

SoulConsumption_151.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_151.text: That's my reward for everything I suffered. That's why I survived ten years of torment. The fighting, the clawing, the loneliness, the fucking loneliness...

SoulConsumption_8.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_8.text: All of it, so I could rot. Because the person I trusted - I loved that fucking animal - gave me away to the devil.

SoulConsumption_118.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_118.text: What the fuck am I supposed to do now?
SoulConsumption_118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly she has burnt through her rage and sorrow moves in its place. She crumples, and the tears begin.

SoulConsumption_156.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_156.text: I should just end it all now. On my terms.

SoulConsumption_117.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_117.text: But then who'd save this fucking place.
SoulConsumption_117.context: NodeContext: With a smile, breaking her own awful mood

SoulConsumption_9.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_9.context: NodeContext: Exhausted, this is a bit of droll response to the player telling her to live with the time she has left. It has an essence of humor, though she's still devastated

SoulConsumption_114.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_114.text: All right. I think I can do this. Time to... keep going.
SoulConsumption_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back toward peanut gallery, ready to leave.NodeContext: Chuckling.

SoulConsumption_61.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_61.text: Protect the city I love, I guess.

SoulConsumption_48.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_48.text: The 'Absolute' can have Baldur's Gate when I'm dead. Which may be in the next few minutes, but until then, no.
SoulConsumption_48.context: NodeContext: Mock unwillingness, like a teen agreeing to come down to dinner after crying it out with her mom. Good humoured, but one last moan of indignity.

SoulConsumption_105.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_105.text: There's nothing to know. There's nothing left.

SoulConsumption_154.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SoulConsumption_154.text: Vengeance can be a bitter tonic to kind hearts. Give her a moment.
SoulConsumption_154.context: NodeContext: sympathetic, soft. Genuinely cares about Karlach, who is the 'gentle heart' of this moment

SoulConsumption_116.speaker: Shadowheart
SoulConsumption_116.text: Karlach? Talk to me - what's the matter?

SoulConsumption_155.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SoulConsumption_155.text: Your vengeance is complete, Karlach. You should rejoice.
SoulConsumption_155.context: NodeContext: encouraging an ally who is despondent despite a victory

SoulConsumption_123.speaker: Minsc
SoulConsumption_123.context: NodeContext: trying to step lightly around his clearly upset friend.

SoulConsumption_86.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SoulConsumption_86.text: Your vengeance is complete, Karlach. Do you not feel joy?
SoulConsumption_86.context: NodeContext: confused by an ally's lack of enthusiasm after killing a villain. Sincerely concerned

SoulConsumption_98.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_98.text: I'm going back to camp. If I don't immolate in the night, I'll deal with this sorry shit tomorrow.

SoulConsumption_139.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_139.text: So Gortash is nothing more than a pile of flesh, same as the rest of us.

SoulConsumption_6.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_6.text: I don't feel like I've won. All I feel is tired.

SoulConsumption_59.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_59.text: Is that it, then? I've killed the bastard who ruined my life, and now I crawl into a corner and die?

SoulConsumption_152.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_152.text: This is all a lot to take in. It's no wonder you're overwhelmed.

SoulConsumption_153.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_153.text: I'm beyond overwhelmed. I'm... I'm finished.

SoulConsumption_20.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_20.text: It makes no sense. None of it means anything.

SoulConsumption_138.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_138.text: He's dead, and he's no fucking sorrier now than he was before.

SoulConsumption_125.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_125.text: What was the point? I'm still dying. I'm dying. I'm going to die!
SoulConsumption_125.context: NodeContext: Finally breaking down emotionally, beating chest with one hand, evoking the infernal engine that's killing her.

SoulConsumption_75.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_75.text: But you're not dead yet. I'm here with you, and I will be until the very end.

SoulConsumption_51.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_51.text: Don't say that. Say you found some way to fix me. That now Gortash is dead, I'll get my heart back.

SoulConsumption_16.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_16.text: My heart. It was mine, and they took it.

SoulConsumption_85.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_85.text: I'm going to be as dead as Gortash any day now. Any moment. And what then?

SoulConsumption_99.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_99.text: Off to the City of Judgement to waste into oblivion? Into the dirt to get eaten by maggots? Is that it for me?! Is that fucking all?!

SoulConsumption_36.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_36.text: And you - you'll just keep going, won't you. Watching the stars. Warming your hands on the campfire. Dancing, eating, making fucking love all night - all of it, all of it.

SoulConsumption_34.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_34.text: That's my reward for everything I suffered. That's why I survived ten years of torment. The fighting, the clawing, the loneliness, the fucking loneliness...

SoulConsumption_137.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_137.text: All of it, so I could rot. Because the person I trusted the most gave me away to the devil.

SoulConsumption_69.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_69.text: It isn't fair. I don't want it like this.
SoulConsumption_69.context: CinematicNodeContext: Suddenly she has burnt through her rage and sorrow moves in its place. She crumples, and the tears begin.

SoulConsumption_132.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_132.text: I would do anything to change it, but I just can't.

SoulConsumption_15.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_15.text: You could try. Haven't you got a Wish spell in that pack of yours?
SoulConsumption_15.context: NodeContext: gallows humor. Wish spell is the most powerful in the world.

SoulConsumption_141.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_141.text: What the fuck am I supposed to do now?

SoulConsumption_144.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_144.text: I don't know. But whatever it is, I think we're meant to do it together.

SoulConsumption_19.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_19.text: I ought to just end it all now. On my terms.

SoulConsumption_52.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_52.text: But then who'd save this godforsaken town.
SoulConsumption_52.context: NodeContext: With a smile, breaking her own awful mood

SoulConsumption_58.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_58.text: Live. For as long as you can.

SoulConsumption_30.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_30.context: NodeContext: Exhausted, this is a bit of droll response to the player telling her to live with the time she has left. It has an essence of humor, though she's still devastated

SoulConsumption_129.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_129.text: Let's get out of here. I've always hated this place. Stupid fucking gigantic bridge or whatever.

SoulConsumption_165.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_165.text: I think I need to go to camp for a while. Be alone. Scream at the sky. You can come and find me later, if you want to.

SoulConsumption_11.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_11.text: Thanks for listening. For existing. Love you.

SoulConsumption_72.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_72.text: You might only find a pile of ash, but I'll be there all the same.

SoulConsumption_119.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_119.text: Protect Baldur's Gate until your dying breath.

SoulConsumption_143.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_143.context: NodeContext: Mock unwillingness, like a teen agreeing to come down to dinner after crying it out with her mom. Good humoured, but one last moan of indignity.

SoulConsumption_93.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_93.context: NodeContext: Crying, but also laughing a little. She really just doesn't know.

SoulConsumption_145.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_145.text: Pray Karlach's soul will be looked after in the afterlife.

SoulConsumption_84.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player bows their head in prayer; Karlach follows suit. After a little, she looks up and speaks.

SoulConsumption_71.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_71.text: You better be right or I'll haunt your arse.

SoulConsumption_160.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_160.text: They grant my power; perhaps they'll grant this prayer.

SoulConsumption_147.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_147.text: Not exactly encouraging. But I'll take what I can get.

SoulConsumption_109.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_109.text: I'm a cleric; I have to say yes.

SoulConsumption_113.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_113.text: I guess I'm not the only one bound by something beyond my control.

SoulConsumption_140.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_140.text: Ask for a miracle; that Karlach's life be saved.

SoulConsumption_96.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_96.text: That's a big ask. You in good with the powers that be?

SoulConsumption_91.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_91.text: Well then. Maybe I have a chance after all.

SoulConsumption_122.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_122.text: I still have access to my magic, so they haven't given up on me yet.

SoulConsumption_149.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_149.text: Thanks for not giving up on me, either.

SoulConsumption_124.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_124.text: I should've yoked my fate to a better cleric.
SoulConsumption_124.context: NodeContext: gentle ribbing. She's still emotionally cut up but ready to joke

SoulConsumption_64.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_64.text: Just close your eyes and tell the gods what you're feeling. Some among them will understand.

SoulConsumption_146.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_146.context: CinematicNodeContext: She closes her eyes and bows her head in prayer.

SoulConsumption_133.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_133.text: I begged one of them to claim my soul. Hoping for Lathander or Selûne, but at this point I've probably done more to earn Loviatar's interest.
SoulConsumption_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Opens one eye and looks up mischievously.NodeContext: Still sad but back to being a little cheeky

SoulConsumption_40.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_40.text: Let it out. It's about time.

SoulConsumption_83.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_83.text: I don't want to die. I want to live. I want to stay.

SoulConsumption_107.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_107.text: It is what it is. It's time to soldier forward with the time you have left.

SoulConsumption_78.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_78.text: I deserve better. I deserve more. I deserve to live. I. Deserve. To. LIVE.

SoulConsumption_111.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_111.text: We're all going to die one day. In the end, we're all the same.

SoulConsumption_95.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_95.text: I don't want you to die. It makes no sense.

SoulConsumption_164.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_164.text: It's evil. I was so young when this fucker betrayed me. So naive. They stole my heart before I even knew what I had.

SoulConsumption_45.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_45.text: Maybe we can still fix your engine; stabilise it.

SoulConsumption_29.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_29.text: Got a miracle in your back pocket you forgot to tell me about?

SoulConsumption_22.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_22.text: Karlach, it doesn't need to be this way. You can still return to Avernus.

SoulConsumption_60.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_60.text: I don't want to go back to Hell! I shouldn't have to! I want to live - I want to live here, in my home, with my own heart.
SoulConsumption_60.context: NodeContext: Responding to the player suggesting she could return to Avernus to avoid dying. She doesn't want to consider this and it irritates her to be reminded of it.

SoulConsumption_158.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_158.text: I can't do it anymore. Ten years, man. It's enough. It's enough.

SoulConsumption_88.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_88.text: Life isn't fair. Get used to it.

SoulConsumption_68.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_68.text: Fuck you! Fuck him and fuck you! I don't need life to be fair, I just need to live it!

SoulConsumption_54.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_54.text: Feel like I should laugh but I'm just too godsdamned tired.

SoulConsumption_17.speaker: Player
SoulConsumption_17.text: You can sense she's working something out; say nothing.

SoulConsumption_131.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_131.text: I feel like there should be a sunset for me to ride off into. Or an orchestral swell or... something.

SoulConsumption_62.speaker: Karlach
SoulConsumption_62.text: But there's nothing, is there? I killed the bastard who ruined my life, and my prize is that I get to crawl into a corner and die.
